meanings.definition: A person who skids or slides
meanings.sent1: The skidders at the ice rink were having a great time gliding around.
meanings.sent2: The skidders raced down the hill on their sleds.
meanings.sent3: The skidders in the skating competition showed off their smooth moves.
meanings.sent4: She was a true skidders, effortlessly sliding through the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The little skidders giggled as they slipped and slid on the frozen pond.

meanings.definition: A vehicle used for hauling logs
meanings.sent1: The skidders transported the heavy logs from the forest.
meanings.sent2: The lumber company used skidders to move the timber efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The skidders in the logging yard were always busy carrying logs.
meanings.sent4: The old skidders groaned as they pulled the massive logs behind them.
meanings.sent5: The powerful skidders made light work of moving the logs across the rugged terrain.

meanings.definition: A type of footwear with a smooth sole for sliding on ice or snow
meanings.sent1: She put on her skidders before heading out to the icy pond.
meanings.sent2: The children wore skidders to glide effortlessly on the snowy slope.
meanings.sent3: His skidders made him look like he was dancing on the frozen lake.
meanings.sent4: The skidders felt like magic shoes as she slid gracefully on the snow.
meanings.sent5: The skidders left a trail of smooth imprints on the fresh snow.
